title.jp: A Surprised Doremi! The New Ojamajo

synopsis: When Hana misses her mothers, she lets out a cry, thereby transforming Maho-Dou and transforming herself into an 11-year-old. Shortly after, Hana goes to the Human World to attend Doremi's school and shocks the Ojamajos with her new look.
Hana begins sixth grade, but cannot read or write.
Pop is due to take her Level 2 exam and Hana is due to take her Level 9 exam. When Pop witnesses Hana pass her Level 9 exam, she gets jealous at how fast she is progressing.
The MAHO-Dou is getting less money than normal from the reopening. Hana tries to solve the problem on her own.
Onpu, tired from her busy life, cannot see her father. Hana breaks her promise with her and pretends to be Onpu to go to her fashion shoots.

title.jp: The Mystery Combo Of Class Librarians!?

synopsis: Hana meets a girl who is fond of books, so she uses magic to send them inside the story.

title.jp: Open Up! The Door to Your Heart

synopsis: One of Majo Tourbillon's children loved seashells. To remove a cursed bramble from her, they make a seashell necklace and open the door to her heart.

title.jp: Did They Figure it Out!? Hana-chan's Secret

synopsis: Nobuko and Miho create a manga called "Hana's Secret", which is about Hana being a witch.
Hadzuki feels that she and Yada are becoming distant as he becomes closer to Shiori.

title.jp: School Trip!! It's Tough Being The Group Leader

synopsis: For the upcoming field trip to Nara and Kyoto, Hana volunteers to be leader for her group. However, she has yet to learn what the responsibilities mean.
On the class study trip to Nara, Doremi and the girls meet up with the FLAT4 again.
As the class settles in Kyoto, Kotake tries to protect Doremi from Akatsuki. Hana is turned back into a baby and the girls must hide her for the night.
Mutsumi wants to retire pro-wrestling after seeing her wrestling idol, Candy, retire.
Hana goes through her level 7 witch exam.
As Mother's Day approaches, Hadzuki and Onpu get upset with their mothers.

title.jp: How to Make a Rainbow That Doesn't Disappear

synopsis: A rainy day helps Baba remember one of Majo Tourbillon's children. The rainbow that comes after gives the girls an idea for removing a bramble from the Past Queen.

Doremi and the girls find out that the boys in the 6th grade are hiding out in a secret clubhouse, home of Miyamae's homemade airplanes. The girls offer to help out, but unfortunately, Reika hears of this and tries to exploit them.

title.jp: Where There Are Woofs, There Is Love

synopsis: Nishizawa falls in love with a younger man who works at a pet shop. After over hearing about how she lied about owning a dog, Hana becomes a dog to help her out.
The girls decide to give the daughter of a sushi bar owner and the daughter of a bath house owner a break by doing they're jobs for them.
The girls reflect on what they want to pursue. Momoko doesn't know what her dream is and meets a similar boy on the same search.

Hana is sent to look for the missing Tortoise for her next witch exam. On the way, she runs into Oyajide, who is in the middle of his own exam that would release his punishment of working at the Witch World Preschool and allow his return back to the Wizard World.
Kimitaka is moving away to Hokkaido. The day before he moves, he confesses his love for Pop.
Tanabata is fast approaching, but Altair and Vega refuse to meet with one another.

title.jp: Love and Justice! We Are the Majo Rangers!

synopsis: Hana is devastated that her recently favorite show, "Battle Rangers"; is coming to an end, and therefore is determined to stop this by all means.

title.jp: They Can Create Smiles? The Mysterious Glass Cups

synopsis: Glass cups sent to the witch apprentices are revealed to be enchanted! Baba remembers one of the Past Queen's children due to the resemblance of the cups.

title.jp: Heating up With Camping and Curry!?

synopsis: The 6th grade goes on a camping trip. During a scavenger hunt, Doremi and Kotake get lost.

title.jp: Nice to Meet You, White Elephant!

synopsis: During a festival, Hana meets a white elephant who is left alone by the others. She befriends this elephant, whom she names Pao.
While the others decide to do different projects for school, Hadzuki and another classmate decide to help out at a retirement home.

title.jp: Don't Let Go! Our Connecting Hands

synopsis: Hana gets lost during the Summer Festival, but meets a mysterious boy and makes him promise not to let go of her hand.

title.jp: A Suspicious Shadow!? Uneasiness Throughout the Witch World

synopsis: After the Queen of the Witch World falls ill while disguised, the girls go to the Witch World. They reunite with Pao as the Queen and Majo Rin look into an old legend.

title.jp: Pao-chan Is A Troublesome Magic Elephant!?

synopsis: There is a legend of a White Elephant who can cure people that are cursed. Pao may be that elephant when Majo Rika falls under a curse.

title.jp: I'm a Good Kid, But I'm Frustrated

synopsis: Hana becomes sick of the girls constantly keeping tabs on her. She befriends model student Sachiko, who secretly wishes her parents weren't teachers so they could spend more time with her.
To everyone's surprise, Onpu does not pass a movie audition that would have made her debut in Hollywood.
When Baba falls ill, she dreams of one of Majotourbillion's children as she is recovering.

title.jp: Level 4 exam is Lo, Lo, Lo, Lo?

synopsis: The girls prepare Hana and her fairy, Toto, for their Level 4 exam.

title.jp: The Bicycle That Goes Any Where

synopsis: Hana learns how to ride a bicycle while she and Morikawa try to cure Hiroko of her phobia of bicycles.
The Wizard World has been invaded by the virus of the former witch queen.

title.jp: Finally a Second Marriage!? Aiko's Decision

synopsis: Aiko and her dad go to Osaka so Aiko's dad can propose to Aiko's mom again.

title.jp: Doremi and the Witch Stop Being Witches

synopsis: Doremi, who has no clue about her future, meets a retired witch named Mirai, who gives her guidance.

title.jp: Pop Becomes a Witch Early On!?

synopsis: Pop takes the Level 1 exam, but becomes worried about her bond with Doremi when she has to decide whether to become a witch or stay a human.

title.jp: I Have to Decide!? Hazuki's Road

synopsis: Hazuki discovers that her mother is making her take the entrance exam to Karen Girls Academy without her knowledge. Her mother shares a secret of her past as to why she did so.

title.jp: The Level 1 Exam! Tamaki's Desperate Situation!!

synopsis: Tamaki falls under the virus of the Witch Queen. Hana decides to cure her for her Level 1 exam.
The girls meet Robby, Roy's Grandson. Apparently, he has the final item, a tapestry, that can rid the Queen's curse.
While the girls finish up the tapestry, brambles spread more and more.

title.jp: Farewell, The Curse of the Witch-Frogs!

synopsis: The Queen has been set free from her curse, and faces a new future.

title.jp: Even If You Go Far Away

synopsis: As Onpu is accepted into a different middle school, Momoko is given the choice to move back to New York or stay in Japan.
Aiko goes to Osaka to help take care of her grandfather at the hospital. Her parents make the decision to take care of him at home, and as a result, decide to move back to Osaka.
Hazuki secretly wants to apply to her dream school, but becomes conflicted over choosing her desires over staying with Doremi.

The girls must make the hardest decision ever: if they become full-fledged witches, they must stay in the Witch World forever. If they don't, they can never see Hana again and never return to the Witch World until Hana becomes the new queen of the Witch World.

title.jp: Thank You! Until We Meet Again

synopsis: On the day of graduation, Doremi refuses to attend school in fear of losing her friends forever. So she locks her self up in the Maho-Dou. Hana threatens to use magic, and Doremi comes out just in time before she shows everyone. In the end, after graduation, the girls send off Hana-chan, Majo Rika and the fairies with Hana promising to become the Queen fast so the can see each other again. Hana turns back into a baby when she enters the witch world. Doremi calls out to her and Hana-Chan turns around and says, "Thank you." While the theme for the original Ojamajo Doremi is played they show Momo-Chan and her parents in the airport while she says "See you. You are my best friend. I love you.(In english)" Onpu is shown with her parents in front of their car. Aiko is shown with her parents getting on the train. Hazuki is shown with Pop and (Doremi's) parents is Doremi's house. In the witch world Hana and the other babies are shown laying on Pao. Momo is shown in America showing Beth pictures of the past year with Doremi, Hana, and the others. Onpu is shown signing autographs for her fans. Aiko is shown bring tayoyaki to her dad, mom and grandpa. Hazuki is shown in a store with her mom. Her mom picks out a dress and Hazuki says 'no' and shows her something she likes. Doremi is shown giving a love-letter to someone.
